intro: Fagonia ovalifolia subsp. pakistanica, commonly known as the Pakistan fagonia, is a shrub native to the arid regions of Pakistan. It is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a hardy species in semi-desert environments. It belongs to the family Zygophyllaceae and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of local flora in its native habitat.
